docs.snippet: The inaugural production by Ms. Kempson’s company, 7 Daughters of Eve Thtr. & Perf. Co., is a consideration of how stories are told and who gets to tell them....
docs.lead_paragraph: The inaugural production by Ms. Kempson’s company, 7 Daughters of Eve Thtr. & Perf. Co., is a consideration of how stories are told and who gets to tell them.
docs.abstract: Alexis Soloski reviews 7 Daughters of Eve Thtr & Perf Co production of play Let Us Now Praise Susan Sontag, written and directed by Sibyl Kempson, at Abrons Art Center.

docs.snippet: Former President Bill Clinton said on Wednesday that an anti-crime crackdown when he was in office in the 1990s went too far, and said he now supports his wife Hillary's plans to reverse some of those justice policies....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Bill Clinton said on Wednesday that an anti-crime crackdown when he was in office in the 1990s went too far, and said he now supports his wife Hillary's plans to reverse some of those justice policies.

headline.main: Bill Clinton Says Tough '90s Crime Bill Went Too Far
headline.print_headline: Bill Clinton Says Tough '90s Crime Bill Went Too Far

docs.snippet: Amid a rash of high-profile incidents involving allegations of police overreach, police unions are trying to adapt to a rapidly changing political context....
docs.lead_paragraph: Amid a rash of high-profile incidents involving allegations of police overreach, police unions are trying to adapt to a rapidly changing political context.
docs.abstract: News Analysis; police unions in many cities, which have basked in nearly impregnable political positions for decades, are now scrambling to adapt amid series of high-profile incidents involving accusations of misconduct and overreach; unions are viewed as characteristically immovable when it comes to what they see as large, institutional threats.

headline.main: Police Struggle With Loss of Privileged Position

docs.snippet: On the dangerous comfort of thinking that Putin's Russia isn't as bad as Stalin's....
docs.lead_paragraph: On the dangerous comfort of thinking that Putin's Russia isn't as bad as Stalin's.

docs.snippet: A measure would give the intelligence services the right to gather potentially unlimited electronic data from Internet communications, and to tap cellphones and capture text messages....
docs.lead_paragraph: A measure would give the intelligence services the right to gather potentially unlimited electronic data from Internet communications, and to tap cellphones and capture text messages.
docs.abstract: France appears poised to enact legislation that could grant authorities far broader spying capabilities with almost no judicial oversight; measure's urgency stems from Paris terrorist attacks in January 2015; new powers would allow intelligence services to glean potentially unlimited electronic data from cellphones and Internet.

headline.main: Lawmakers in France Move to Vastly Expand Surveillance
headline.print_headline: French Take Step to Vastly Widen Domestic Spying

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
